# Bayesian Inference for Epidemic Models

During this session [Poppy](http://chicas.lancaster-university.uk/people/miller.html) will be giving an introduction to basic epidemiological models and how to perform Bayesian inference for them.

## Material
* Supplementary readings:
  * [Bayesian inference for partially observed stochastic epidemics](https://github.com/chicas-spatstat-reading-group/events/blob/master/05-Epidemic-Models/Material/O-Neill_Roberts_1999_Bayesian%20inference%20for%20partially%20observed%20stochastic%20epidemics.pdf)
  * [Bayesian Inference for Stochastic Epidemics in Populations with Random Social Structure](https://github.com/chicas-spatstat-reading-group/events/blob/master/05-Epidemic-Models/Material/BRITTON_et_al-2002-Scandinavian_Journal_of_Statistics.pdf)
  * [Bayesian Analysis for Emerging Infectious Diseases](https://github.com/chicas-spatstat-reading-group/events/blob/master/05-Epidemic-Models/Material/Bayesian_analysis_for_emerging_diseases_Jewell_Kypraios_Neal_Roberts_2009.pdf)
  * [A Contribution to the Mathematical Theory of Epidemics](https://github.com/chicas-spatstat-reading-group/events/blob/master/05-Epidemic-Models/Material/kermack1927.pdf)
  * [Kyprarios MSc Thesis](https://github.com/chicas-spatstat-reading-group/events/blob/master/05-Epidemic-Models/Material/kypraios.pdf)
* [Slides](https://github.com/chicas-spatstat-reading-group/events/blob/master/05-Epidemic-Models/Material/epidemic_modelling_slides.pdf)
* [R code](https://github.com/chicas-spatstat-reading-group/events/tree/master/05-Epidemic-Models/R%20Code)
